qas.question: What is the social style of hunter-gather societies?
Where do people who are an exception to egalitarianism live?
what group of hunter-gatherers are nearly all egalitarian?
Nomadic hunter-gatherers are an exception to what rule?
Those inhabiting the Northeast Coast of North America are what kind of of hunter-gatherers?
Very few African hunter-gatherers are what?

plausible_answers.text: as influential and powerful as men

qas.question: In American culture, women are roughly what?
Women are not at all influential and powerful in what culture?

context: Hunter-gatherers tend to have an <a0_0><b3_0>egalitarian<a0_0/> social ethos<b3_0/>, although <b4_0>settled<b4_0/> hunter-gatherers (for example, those inhabiting the <a1_0>Northwest Coast of North America<a1_0/>) are an exception to this rule. Nearly all <a2_0><b7_0>African<b7_0/><a2_0/> hunter-gatherers are <b5_0>egalitarian<b5_0/>, with women roughly <b6_0>as influential and powerful as men<b6_0/>.
